poem:
The Executive Order  

Amidst the papers' rustle,  
whispers of policy   
flutter like autumn leaves—  
a sale or a ban—  
  
to unravel economies  
where screens sway and  
teenagers dance,  
  
a fingertip poised,  
an oracle of delays,  
pauses the grumbling  
of a machine dreaming  
in viral tongues.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Donald Trump weighing up TikTok ban delay, reports claims Donald Trump is considering suspending a TikTok ban in the US with an executive order when he enters the White House on 20 January, according to a report. The president-elect is exploring an executive order that would postpone enforcement of a sale-or-ban law due to come into force on 19 January, said the Washington Post.
